meanings.sent1: The rock had a rounded edge, making it safe for children to play around.
meanings.sent2: She picked up a rounded pebble from the beach and put it in her pocket.
meanings.sent3: The rounded corners of the table made it look like a friendly piece of furniture.
meanings.sent4: The rounded hills in the distance looked like sleeping giants under the setting sun.
meanings.sent5: The rounded petals of the flower felt soft to the touch.

meanings.definition: Complete or whole in every aspect
meanings.sent1: Her rounded knowledge of the subject impressed the professor.
meanings.sent2: The team celebrated their victory with a rounded sense of accomplishment.
meanings.sent3: The rounded story left no loose ends, satisfying all the readers.
meanings.sent4: His rounded understanding of the situation allowed him to make the best decision.
meanings.sent5: The rounded meal included appetizers, main course, and dessert.

meanings.definition: To make something round in shape
meanings.sent1: She rounded the edges of the clay pot to give it a more pleasing look.
meanings.sent2: The sculptor rounded the marble block into a beautiful statue.
meanings.sent3: He rounded the dough carefully to create perfectly shaped cookies.
meanings.sent4: The carpenter rounded the corners of the table for a safer design.
meanings.sent5: The artist rounded the lines in the drawing to soften its appearance.
